 30namespace vsip
 31{
 32
 33/// Solve a real symmetric or complex Hermetian positive definite Toeplitz
 34/// linear system.
 35///
 36/// Solves:
 37///   :equation:`T x = B` for x, given T and B.
 38///
 39/// Arguments:
 40///   :t: an input vector of length N, first row of the Toeplitz matrix.
 41///   :b: an input vector of length N.
 42///   :y: a vector of length N used for temporary workspace.
 43///   :x: a vector of length N, for the result to be stored.
 44///
 45/// Effects:
 46///   On return, X contains solution to system :equation:`T X = B`.
 47///
 48/// Returns: X.
 49///
 50/// Throws:
 51///   computation_error if T is ill-formed (non postive definite)
 52///   bad_alloc if allocation fails.
 53///
 54template <typename T,
 55	  typename Block0,
 56	  typename Block1,
 57	  typename Block2,
 58	  typename Block3>
 59const_Vector<T, Block3>
 60toepsol(const_Vector<T, Block0> t,
 61	const_Vector<T, Block1> b,
 62	Vector<T, Block2>       y,
 63	Vector<T, Block3>       x)
 64VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc, computation_error))
 65{
 66  typedef typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type scalar_type;
 67
 68  assert(t.size() == b.size());
 69  assert(t.size() == y.size());
 70  assert(t.size() == x.size());
 71
 72  length_type n = t.size();
 73
 74
 75  typename const_Vector<T, Block0>::subview_type r = t(Domain<1>(1, 1, n-1));
 76  Vector<T> tmpv(n);
 77
 78  scalar_type beta  = 1.0;
 79  scalar_type scale = impl::fn::impl_real(t.get(0));
 80  T           alpha = impl::fn::impl_conj(-r.get(0)/scale);
 81  T           tmps; 
 82  
 83  alpha = impl::fn::impl_conj(-r.get(0)/scale);
 84  
 85  y.put(0, alpha);
 86  x.put(0, b.get(0) / scale);
 87
 88  for (index_type k=1; k<n; ++k)
 89  {
 90    beta *= (1.0 - magsq(alpha));
 91    if (beta == 0.0)
 92    { 
 93      VSIP_IMPL_THROW(computation_error("TOEPSOL: not full rank"));
 94    } 
 95
 96    tmps = dot(impl_conj(r(Domain<1>(k))), x(Domain<1>(k-1, -1, k)));
 97    T mu = (b.get(k) - tmps) / (scale*beta);
 98
 99    // x(Domain<1>(k)) += mu * impl_conj(y(Domain<1>(k-1, -1, k)));
100    x(Domain<1>(k)) = mu * impl_conj(y(Domain<1>(k-1, -1, k)))
101                    + x(Domain<1>(k));
102    x.put(k, mu);
103
104    if (k < (n - 1))
105    {
106      tmps  = dot(impl_conj(r(Domain<1>(k))), y(Domain<1>(k-1, -1, k)));
107      alpha = -(tmps + impl::fn::impl_conj(r.get(k))) / (scale*beta);
108      
109      tmpv(Domain<1>(k)) = alpha * impl_conj(y(Domain<1>(k-1, -1, k))) 
110	                 + y(Domain<1>(k));
111      y(Domain<1>(k)) = tmpv(Domain<1>(k));
112      y.put(k, alpha);
113    }
114  }
115
116  return x;
117}
118
119
120
121/// Solve a real symmetric or complex Hermetian positive definite Toeplitz
122/// linear system.
123
124/// Solves:
125///   T x = B
126/// for x, given T and B.
127///
128/// Requires:
129///   T to be an input vector of length N, first row of the Toeplitz matrix.
130///   B to be an input vector of length N.
131///   Y to be a vector of length N used for temporary workspace.
132///
133/// Effects:
134///   Returns vector X of length N, solution to system T X = B.
135///
136/// Throws:
137///   computation_error if T is ill-formed (non postive definite)
138///   bad_alloc if allocation fails.
139
140template <typename T,
141	  typename Block0,
142	  typename Block1,
143	  typename Block2>
144const_Vector<T>
145toepsol(
146   const_Vector<T, Block0> t,
147   const_Vector<T, Block1> b,
148   Vector<T, Block2>       y)
149VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc, computation_error))
150{
151  Vector<T> x(t.size());
152  return toepsol(t, b, y, x);
153}
154
155} // namespace vsip
156
157#endif // VSIP_CORE_SOLVER_TOEPSOL_HPP
